clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Regan Tangjiang for Treating the Common Cold With Wind-heat Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Regan Tangjiang for Treating the Common Cold With Wind-heat Syndrome: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel-Group, Placebo and Active-Controlled Phase 2b Study

brief_summary.textblock: Efficacy and Safety of Regan Tangjiang for treating the common cold with wind-heat syndrome: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel-Group, Placebo and Active-Controlled Phase 2b Study

primary_outcome.description: The median time from the first dosing to time when the body temperature drops by at least 0.5℃.In this study, all patients will be required to record their body temperature in the patient diary every 2 hours within the first 12 hours and every 4 hours during the following 12 hours. After that, it should be recorded four times at a fixed time every day.

secondary_outcome.description: The median time from the first dose administration to the time when the body temperature drops below 37.3℃ and lasts for 24 hours.
The median time from study enrollment to the time when each individual symptom （such as fever, pharyngalgia, headache, runny nose, blocked nose, sneezing, cough） completely disappear.
The percentage of patients with each individual symptom completely disappear from study enrollment to three days treatments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy in TCM symptom and sign scores
secondary_outcome.description: The TCM symptom scoring system used in the study follows the Guidelines for Clinical Research of New Chinese Medicine, in which all symptoms are graded.
Usage of emergency medicines is defined as the percentage of patients using emergency medicines (paracetamol).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Simulation Regan Tangjiang and Shufengjiere Capsules

intervention.description: The treatment duration is 3 consecutive days.
